website_summaries.verdict: A large but sturdy outdoor antenna that performs to advertised specifications in most cases, even in hilly or wooded areas.
pros: Simple to assemble w/an attractive form factor
Some users found it works well even installed in the attic
Holds up well in snow, rain, wind
cons: Antenna is not omnidirectional and must be aimed at towers
Signal booster must be purchased separately

customer_reviews.title: I live on the 34th Floor in Manhattan and I cannot get reliable connection. do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I kept it too long to return it, and it has gotten worse over time. not worth the $40 price tag! Better options out there. In NYC I should be able to get every channel clearly in a skyscraper!
customer_reviews.author: opinionated consumer

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my flat indoor antenna
customer_reviews.text: About 30 miles from DC. Flat 50-mile antenna could pick up 30-odd channels, but not all by facing the same direction unless I hung it outside. I'd also have needed tacks or Velcro as it could not hang flush on the window/wall and kept falling. Solved the issues with this unit that claims 10 more miles in range and, perhaps more importantly, has a dedicated VHF receiver for the few channels using it. It's sitting indoors and I don't have to move it. NOTE: Co-ax cable not included, and I screwed it to a wooden bookshelf. The mounting design really doesn't secure it well in this position, but it balances with enough friction to stay upright indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many of these 'flat' antennas that tout 25-35-45 mile range and NONE of them are any good. All of my local stations are within 13 miles, and with this antenna, mounted high on a second-floor wall, reception was spotty on some channels, and non-existent on 3 channels. I would not recommend this product. My older GE 34140 Indoor / Outdoor / Attic Antenna is much better. I bought it from Amazon in 2016, and I'm guessing it was a few years old product even then. It works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't make 60 Mile range
customer_reviews.text: I have a 30 mile line of sight to Lookout Mountain, Golden Colorado where most Denver stations are located. The antenna received 80% of the full power stations (pretty bad) and NONE of the LPTV stations from there for a total of 35 channels.I put my weather beaten 25 year old Radio Shack Yagi back up and got all the stations plus LPTV station for a total of 56 channels. This antenna is crap in a nice box. Don't waste your money like I did. FYI I am a video technician, maintaining TV transmitters along the colorado front range.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work....
customer_reviews.text: I am a 30 year electrician, I installed this antenna, did a channel scan-nothing. Not one channel, my towers are less then 50 miles away. Didn't work for me.....
customer_reviews.author: sparkyjoe1

customer_reviews.title: Cut the cord now!!!
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase and excited about finally cutting the cord from sattelite and cable. This product was extremely easy to install and tied right into the existing infrastructure in my home. I used a compass to ensure I was at the right azimuth for the broadcasting station and receive 32 digital channels over the air for free! I live 25 miles from the broadcast station in a housing development so I was worried about interference but everything worked great. The HD resolution is better than I've ever seen with cable and sattelite. I was very surprised!! Couldn't be happier with this antenna!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BrewCrewJake

customer_reviews.title: Don’t listen to good reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t pay attention to the good reviews. I was so excited to get this because I thought I would get every station nearby coming in. I only got one channel, what a letdown! I moved it to several locations and still could only get one channel in. I bought the 50 mile amplified antenna and all of the broadcast stations are within 35 miles so that shouldn’t have been a problem. Save your money and get another antenna, I have no clue how this product got so many good reviews. Returning now. The only positive about this product was the shipping speed. I recidivism it in 3 days. The product however is junk in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Lies!!! Range is not true
customer_reviews.text: Product doesn’t work as advertised I’m 38mile away from the major networks. 38miles is apparently too far for this antenna to pick up, I would return but I unfortunately threw out the box. I have installed a preamp and amplified splitter with no luck. Good news though the one channel I get is in Japanese. 🤯
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Antenna, preamplifier. Doesn’t work!!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed!! Bought Channel Master, preamp, there filter! This doesn’t work for me!! I’m not sure if I received bad equipment or this is just junk!! Probably will return this. I wouldn’t recommend this equipment!!!
customer_reviews.author: TGF

customer_reviews.title: Don't move it. Even after a few hours it will take the paint off your wall.
customer_reviews.text: I installed product last evening & picture was fair after moving antenna to different areas. When I found the best spot I applied the sticky tape & attached to wall as instructed. This morning picture was poor. Per instructions you can remove once attached to a different spot but when I peeled it off the wall, the paint came off with it. Now I have a scar on the wall where there used to be paint. If I knew the adhesives would do that, I'd have used scotch tape tk put it up. I wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: J Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: Pictures are better than I get from Verizon FIOS
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly well for me in Waltham MA, I placed it on a second floor south facing wall and am Getting broadcast from Massachusetts and some from Rhode Island. Pictures are better than I get from Verizon FIOS. (Of course I don't, get strictly cable stations) Minor problem, I had trouble peeling off the wall side protective film from the adhesive strip, and I got the advice to stick some adhesive tape on it to get more purchase to lift it and it worked like a charm. I just wish this trick was printed on the instructions, would have saved me some aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph More

customer_reviews.title: So much better than my old one
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Works even stuck to a wall nowhere near a window. Much less unattractive than a traditional black box. Picks up many more channels then the one I replaced even though they should be the same, based on the specs. The packaging was streamlined and made installation steps easy to follow. The picture is crisp and clear. CONS: I would have preferred a white coaxial cable. UPDATE: It didn't do well on Trash Day. Every garbage truck that drove by messed up the reception. I lost many channels and had to reprogram it. If you find this review to be HELPFUL, please click the button below. THX
customer_reviews.author: 1PickyWoman😋

customer_reviews.title: RATED as THE BEST so i picked it.
customer_reviews.text: not a lot to it....wish my tv was located closer to the window (partner will not allow an antenna to be too far from the TV. i get it. its tacky.) with that said even with the snow and wind it was pretty decent picture for what we got it for.( morning news, we have HULU and HBO GO, NETFLIX, Amazon Prime) not sure ill get another for the bedroom considering its not one the side of the building facing the towers in MIDTOWN Manhattan. hopefully the video uploads so u can see how it looks on a 2016 4K TV.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Only 6 channels; placed in window
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this into my new 4k tv and have the antenna clinging to the window at the front of my house. I still was only able to get 6 channels and they're basically unwatchable since they continue to go in and out. I tried my bedroom tv just to see and it was the same. I was really hoping with the signal amp this thing would at the least bring in the more popular local stations but sadly it has been just a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Zope

customer_reviews.title: Not for inside use in apts.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work in an apartment. I tried every where inside and nothing. I do not have outside options so I can't say how it would work there.
customer_reviews.author: kristina

customer_reviews.title: Didn't help at all.
customer_reviews.text: I was using a 2 foot long bare wire for an antenna and thought the Eclipse would get more channels and better reception but I was disappointed it did not. There was no improvement of any kind using this antenna over the bare wire antenna I was using. So I am returning it. I hope it works better for some people but my 5 cents bare wire works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sue D.

customer_reviews.title: Does a BANG up job!
customer_reviews.text: We tried an "attach inside to a glass window" antenna first. Not good enough. This isn't costly but it does a glorious job of bringing in our local stations. The quality never wavers no matter what the weather is. It was easy to put together, even though watching my 72 year old husband climbing onto the roof to install it was a bit breathtaking. Great unit. Feel confident in buying.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Picks up 79 channels vs Mohu Leaf 35/50 60 channels @ 15-30 mile distance from first floor with Signal Strength 80-100%
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is the real deal. I've tried both the Mohu Leaf 35/50, and 65. Neither could touch what this picks up. I went from ~60 channels to ~79, and signal strength went from 50-75% to 80-100% according to the HDHomeRun Config GUI. Wish I had spent the little extra for this months ago to avoid the frustration of trying to place the mohu perfectly to pick up the main 4 networks without one of them cutting out too much. I slapped this on the window and the first place I put it picked up nearly everything, only requiring a couple inch shift to one side to make sure to pick up ABC more clearly.
customer_reviews.author: aMh

customer_reviews.title: Skip all the flat antenna's.  This is the one to buy.
customer_reviews.text: I had initially bought a flat antenna, a slim box type one. It was hit and miss. I then bought bought some other one which sounded good in the description, small, stands on it's own, latest 2020, etc and all that hype. I should if saved my money and bought this one. Indoors and after a few attempts by moving it around and running searches for OTA channels, I eventually hit the sweet spot. I get 35 channels with this, where as the others I would be lucky if 6 came in without interference. I am planning on getting a longer coaxial cable and sitting it outdoors on the porch and see how it goes then. NFL here we come!
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Dunne

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was using a Mohu Leaf 30 with an amplifier previously. I had some issues and decided to give the ClearStream Eclipse a try after reading stellar reviews. I placed the ClearStream (without amplifier) in the exact location the Mohu Leaf was. I rescanned to see what channels I got and every channel came in with a stronger signal even without the amplifier! Now I can get all the channels without an amplifier and without stuttering issues. I do have one complaint that the box I received was not sealed. This was definitely either used or returned. My rating is based on the actual product performance.
customer_reviews.author: Desconfiad

customer_reviews.title: The best of several tested
customer_reviews.text: I think I have bought a dozen different antennas I am In Idaho mountains can’t directly see The transmitter The signals reflect off?? I used plus installed others for neighbors Some have snow problems and more point critical. So far the very all around best performing is the dual model Some using 200 feet coax with line amplifier Many reflected signals are a few feet off the ground and perfect and we search for I don’t understand the last order with a simple dipole added for old VHF Didn’t useth
customer_reviews.author: LEW

customer_reviews.title: Great for UHF, not for VHF
customer_reviews.text: Great for UHF, but useless for VHF! The description should make this clear. By placing this antenna in a 1st floor window, it pulls in the 4 local channel broadcasting on UHF from a mountain 30+ mile away... Impressive! However, my local CBS and ABC broadcast on VHF from a much closer mountain and this will not receive them at all. After looking into it, I see it's optimized for UHF... Fair enough, but that should be explicitly stated, as there are still many HDTV station on VHF. If all the stations you want a UHF, this is a great antenna, but check first... This ones going back.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lee Hendrick

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money...
customer_reviews.text: I live in an urban area well within the stated 35 mile range. There are no tall trees or large buildings that could interfere with reception. When scanning for channels with the antenna, my TV purportedly picked up 30. However, only about 5 of them actually come in clearly. I moved the antenna here, there, everywhere, but cannot pick up my local CBS station, and local NBC/ABC are "iffy". Should have bought a cheap ($11) pair of rabbit ears like my neighbor did because she gets about 25 channels CLEARLY, including all local networks.
customer_reviews.author: Barney1

customer_reviews.title: Don't Count on This For Local Channels
customer_reviews.text: Based on reviews my husband chose this digital antenna. We are 45 me miles from local stations & hoped we'd receive them. If it's cloudy, raining, snowing, wind blowing, sunny, or dark outside then this doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Bklvr15

customer_reviews.title: 26 free channels!!
customer_reviews.text: This antenna worked great for me. I live 20 minutes south of Austin, TX. I installed the antenna outside, on the north side of my house. I ran the cable from outside into the attic and down to the tv in the bedroom. It's a good size and blends in well enough with the exterior of the house. Right now the antenna is pulling in 26 free over the air channels. About 5 of those are in spanish. I posted some pics of the different channels its pulling in on my new Sharp LC-43LE653U.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tibuni

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reception and bang for your money!
customer_reviews.text: The product looked a little cheezy in the photos so I was a little skeptical at first. After reading some of the reviews, I thought I’d give it a try. Admittingly, it exceeded my expectations and ended up purchasing a second. Excellent reception and discrete size/design. Definitely bang for your money! Keep in mind that this antenna may not be for everyone. Read the description and be sure to double check the distance from you and the signal towers. You may need a higher model.
customer_reviews.author: IMO

customer_reviews.title: decent antenna but be sure about location
customer_reviews.text: This indoor antenna is effective in acquiring local channels although it seems to be somewhat directional. If the antenna is at an angle from the broadcast source it does not seem to be as effective. The adhesive grip strip is a one time use only so you better get it in the right location facing the right way before you use it. I would suggest the manufacturer should put several adhesive strips in each package so you can experiment a little with location.
customer_reviews.author: Myronnabq

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: I originally tried one of those thin, flat ~$24 antennas. It worked fine for UHF but not VHF. I decided if I was going to put in effort, I may as well do it "right." This antenna assembled easily and was a breeze. I mounted it to a rafter above my living room in the attic and pointed it UHF north and VHF south. Check the station maps to see where you should point it. Didn't have to adjust it at all. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Garin Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Not working as described.
customer_reviews.text: After the window for return had closed the antenna has stopped working as it should. It doesn’t hold the reception signal and most of the time I can’t get a signal at all. I have repeatedly repositioned the antenna with no improvement. The antenna worked flawlessly for about six weeks before it stopped holding a signal. Now I cannot watch a broadcast show because of an error message -“mode not supported “ or “low or week signal”. It began in the middle of a show one day and has continued.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy It’s Junk
customer_reviews.text: Worked for less then thirty days, constantly moving it around every few days to get a new clearer picture. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very poor reception despite being close to broadcast towers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this antenna for use indoors at a house that is 5-8 miles from two groups of broadcast towers. Terrain is hilly at that location so no clear line-of-sight to either tower group. However, an old RCA "rabbit ears" antenna at least receives a couple of the channels from those towers. I was hoping the Eclipse would be better, but no matter how much I fiddle with the orientation or positioning of the the Eclipse, the same TV can't detect a single channel from one tower group, and from the other, it can detect a few channels but can't display any of them reliably due to weak signal. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. Aramaki

customer_reviews.title: Cut The Cable!
customer_reviews.text: We're about 20 miles from the broadcasters in Washington DC, and 25 miles from Baltimore. Our old antenna had taken a beating over the years from high winds and overgrown tree branches. This one easily mounted on the same mast. I aimed it mostly towards Baltimore and reception for both cities is pretty good for most of the TVs. One TV, the farthest from the antenna, might need a boost but so far we're living with it. Altogether much better than our old antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: PEICE OF JUNK!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received antenna today and it's garbage. I can't get hardly anything on it except pixelated screen. It is very cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Christine  rousseau

customer_reviews.title: Great for cord cutters who might occasionally want to watch local broadcast.
customer_reviews.text: We cut the cord. My wife occasionally like certain things like MeTv. She wanted to be able to watch that, so I got this so she could get it off the local station that broadcasts it. It works well, the only complaint might be the coax cable. We put it white side out, and then you see the black coax cable running to it. Will probably at some point put in a white cable just to obscure it. Good antenna.
customer_reviews.author: MichiganDad

customer_reviews.title: Finally, One that Works for Me!
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble picking up a station that is broadcasting a mere 13 miles from me. It is one of the few broadcast stations in my area that went back to digital transmission on its original VHF frequency. I tried all sorts of antennas, indoor, outdoor, directional, multidirectional. You name it, I tried it. All of them picked up the channels broadcasting in the UHF range, but none of them would pick up the VHF transmission of WMC-5 from Memphis in Millington -- until I installed this antenna on the roof of my mobile home. Not only do I now get Channel 5, I also picked up several new stations I did not even know existed.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrin R. PriceTop Contributor: Chess

customer_reviews.title: San Antonio, the channels I hoped to receive were about 14.  I got 86!
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at so many channels being received. Looking closer, about half were Spanish, not something I speak, and half he remaining were very weak signals that would probably prove irritating to try to watch. So that left me with several more than I expected. I particularly hoped to watch ION tv, but it was way off the direction I pointed my antenna. No matter, so far I get ION very well. I was both amazed and surprised at the results I got with out even "fine-tuning" the antenna positioning. I just guessed at the right direction by eye, then locked it down. wOW!
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, great quality, reliable
customer_reviews.text: (1) Installation was straight forward. I didn't even bother using the provided adhesive. I just taped the antenna to my window. Hasn't fallen down yet! (2) The set up was simple; and I was able to find 80 some channels. Obviously most are garbage, but the local news networks are great (ABC, CBS, NBC, etc.); clear and crisp. I got the 35 mile one and it was enough to reach the nearest towers. I do live in a major city, and the nearest towers were around 20-30 miles away. (3) It's been reliable so far. No major hiccups. Overall: pleased with the antenna, would recommend to anyone wanting to get OTA channels!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I use it to get a few channels and had very low expectations yet, I was pleasantly surprised that it is picking up over 30 channels for free and it is decent picture quality. It gets the job done. I don't even have it near a window, it is just hanging on the wall attached to a Homerun box near my router. This allows me to get OTA tv in every room where the tv is connected to the network. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: SoehligTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Cut the cord with this antenna.....
customer_reviews.text: So I tried two other types of indoor antennas (both highly rated) and results were just so-so. Returned those. I then read a lot of reviews, and based on those reviews I bought 3 of these Clearstream eclipse antennas. Fantastic reception.....no more pixelation, works great! Better off with the unamplified type, I think the amplifier actually made things worse. I've returned my 3 set top boxes , and am now cable free! Feels good to get that noose off my neck , no more cable!
customer_reviews.author: Qmpdeanne

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you can mount on window facing transmission towers.
customer_reviews.text: I am returning. Both my TV's face north and south.only windows to mount face east and north.i live 1 mile from lake erie.east of cleveland,ohio.the lake north.tv towers most likely west of me.my newer hd tv gets 7 stations .very clear. But only ABC as a major network. It worked as described.make sure you can mount it towards towers. So its my fault. Buying an outdoor off of amazon and using existing direct tv coax already set up. I CUT THE CORD. Last year of dirwct tv contract. Went up to$150.00 a month.i fefuse to pay this.bottom line.this antenna most likely does what it claims if mounted towards toweres.
customer_reviews.author: hilaria kerr

customer_reviews.title: This is a UHF only antenna and performed poorly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the many positive reviews and ratings I read on several websites. But I found its performance underwhelming. I only used it a few days and never actually stuck the antenna to the wall using the sticky surface, I simply taped it to the wall in various places. I called the mfgr. who informed me that there is no VHF element inside so that's likely the cause of the problem. I returned it and bought a flat antenna directly from another mfgr. for $8.50 (no cable included) that works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Schizoid

customer_reviews.title: No better than 2V model for VHF
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 2V model but was not satisfied with the VHF reception so I bought the 4V model. The 4V has a larger UHF antenna but VHF antenna is identical to the 2V. And, in my opinion VHF reception is actually a little worse than the 2V. Where I live all the main networks are on VHF channels. If the channels you are trying to get are mainly VHF channels there is no advantage to this model.
customer_reviews.author: Roy N.

customer_reviews.title: Too few channels
customer_reviews.text: The antenna provided access to only two stations in which I had no interest. Easy to install; reprogramming channels on my TV with the "antenna" option was easy. I tried a half dozen locations, mostly on or near a window, and reprogramming. None provided more than the two channels (I particularly wanted PBS). I live in a large east-coast city downtown where there are many channel options. I called customer service four times during their stated working hours (CST) with no live person answering.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Chenier

customer_reviews.title: I did it I cut the cord
customer_reviews.text: I live in a condo on the second floor I can't put it on the roof but in the corner of my deck pointed it north and wow I got 49 channels clear as a bell all the local channels no I didn't get discovery history or the food channels sorry I guess you'll just have to look at them on u-tube this is all FREEEEEEE just add Netflix , prime. And vudo is free with limited commercials and add wi-fi for around $54.00 a month and I'm saving almost $1300,00 a year.
customer_reviews.author: jtra1027

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna for the cord cutters!
customer_reviews.text: I live about 27 miles from the cluster of towers that feeds our valley. I get a total of 84 channels. Granted, there's a bunch of channels I don't watch, but all the network channels come in better than what we had thru DirecTV. This antenna is a great pairing with the firetv recast OTA DVR.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.

customer_reviews.title: Poor capture of local channels
customer_reviews.text: Product looks good but only able to get few local channels . The small cheap antenna we had had better capture and able to receive all local channels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome directional antenna
customer_reviews.text: Awesome directional antenna. I installed it in my attic (so I wouldn't need to worry about grounding it or adding a lightning protection device. I receive every station I have it pointed at. There is no way to remove the reflector, so if you want to receive channels in the opposite direction then buy a second antenna or buy the 2MAX version of this antenna without the reflector. I would have purchased that one if I knew the 2V required the reflector, it is what everything is mounted to, so there is no removing it..
customer_reviews.author: J. G.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get NBC, ABC, or CBS
customer_reviews.text: We tried this in several locations and it does't get any of the local channels, NBC, CBS, ABC. Had better luck with my old rabbit ears than this one. The adhesive does not stick to anything. It falls off the wall within minutes. I would suggest for the manufacturer to add a hole so you can hang it on a screw or a command hook. I think it's just too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: StitchinGal

customer_reviews.title: Item not "new", although in "near-new" condition.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived with item box already opened and adhesive strip already applied to antenna, with cable no longer fastened with the two twist ties, which were loose in the box. But it worked fine, so no real reason to send it back. Pulled in from my ground-floor level all the stations we wanted, including one on the other side of the house that was about 120 degrees away from the others which clustered together behind the bookcase wall where the antenna was hung.
customer_reviews.author: BGW

customer_reviews.title: Great Indoor Reception/Picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: Verizon Fios had stopped airing our local TV station due to a pricing negotiation stalemate. We waited 4 weeks thinking they’d resolve the dispute before purchasing this indoor antenna to watch our local news and some NFL games. I followed the provided instructions and used an App to locate the closest TV tower and within 30 minutes had the antenna mounted and giving us pucture perfect quality reception. We are about 28 miles from the TV Tower and this unit provides a FIOS quality picture on a 68” Vizio TV.
customer_reviews.author: Claudeo58

customer_reviews.title: Sooo GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to install! 1-2-3. Didn't work very well on the wall, but so good on the window. We have tons of trees even though we live near a large city. I am very impressed. Picture great, clear. We got 35 channels. Buying another today for living room. WON'T pay $350 a month for satellite that increases it seems, monthly. If you want to be free, this is the way. So inexpensive too. Read the technical reviews first. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Significantly beter than the "pancake" syle antenna.
customer_reviews.text: I tried the top rated pancake paper flat plastic antennas first to see how that would do since it's way smaller and cheaper and it DID work well for most channels but not all of them. Rather than messing around with middle of the road antennas, I decided to get this one and mounted it in place of my original dish network unit. Connecting to my HD Homerun unit, I saw the signal strength and quality of the channels that were originally 60~70% now all the way up in the 90's%. Channels that were completely gone in bad weather are now viewable and with a pretty good experience all things considered.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Lankford

customer_reviews.title: Once again doing research pays off in a great item.
customer_reviews.text: I had an antenna from about 10 years ago that was doing fine, but I took The Wirecutters recommendation and picked this one up to see if it was better than the one I was using. Living near Detroit I expected to get the basic channels I had been getting, plus a couple that I was hoping would come in with more clarity, this antenna shattered my expectations. I was receiving 25 channels with my old antenna, I now get 44 with this one. If you don't need cable and are just fine with an over the air indoor antenna, you won't do better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: gonzotgreat23

customer_reviews.title: REVIEW MUNKIE : THE ONE REVIEW YOU NEED TO READ
customer_reviews.text: WHAT IS THIS? DUH! ITS A ROOF ANTENNA BECAUSE YOU'VE DECIDED NOT TO PAY AS MUCH MONEY TO VZ, ATT OR YOUR CABLE PROVIDER! THE GOOD LOOKS PRETTY GOOD - NICE BUILD QUALITY AND PULLED IN AROUND 60 CHANNELS AFTER FAFFING AROUND WITH WHICH DIRECTION IT SHOULD BE POINTED. INCLUDES A WALL / ROOF MOUNT BRACKET ! BONUS! THE BAD ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS COULD DO WITH IMPROVING - GOT THERE IN THE END BUT THEY ARE NOT THE BEST. REMOVE ONE STAR! AMAZON WANTED ME TO REVIEW THIS FOR 'SHEERNESS' WHAT ON EARTH!!!!! RECCOMENDED? ABSOLUTELY. VERY GOOD RECEPTION.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: I now get signal strength of 100%
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want a cheap antenna. I did the research online and this antenna was highly recommended. I installed it at the corner of my patio, under the roof line so it was out of the rain and snow. I pointed it toward the TV towers downtown. I wired it to the existing cable box going into my house. I don't use cable but wanted the signal to be carried to the outlets in the house. I get 100% signal strength. No fuzz or buzz, just a good picture.
customer_reviews.author: Maury Lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product support from Antenna Direct
customer_reviews.text: After four years of perfect performance I began to experience pixelization on several channels. Reached out to company asking for advise on a replacement. They responded promptly with questions as to location, channel# etc. After further discussion, they decided to ship me a new 4V antenna. As it turned out, my reception issue was related to the mandated 'repack' currently in progress. I wanted take time to thank Antenna Direct and their customer support team for going above and beyond to help me solve my reception issues. I'm a solid future customer! Thanks again, James
customer_reviews.author: JamesC

customer_reviews.title: Clear picture!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this antenna! 35+ channels indeed.. when I scanned I have access to 90! (I understand this isn’t necessarily the same in all areas, I’m in the San Francisco Area). The picture is very clear. The antenna was literally plug and play, my only suggestion is to get some additional or different double sided mounting adhesive, mine wouldn’t stay in the wall with the one provided- I did and it’s staying up just fine now. The two color sides is a nice feature too, I decided on the white side to blend with my lighter color wall . Mine is also mounted on an outer wall, so not sure how it works on an inner wall.
customer_reviews.author: Sam N.

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with coaxial cable to connect to your tv and antenna. Luckily I had one from when I had cable that wasn't in use. 18 wheelers constantly disrupt the signal, regardless of where I have the antenna inside or outside. Says it picks up 13 channels but only shows 8. Not that annoyed by it since I got the network channels I wanted. For me, I think this is worth buying. Just wish it had a coaxial cable with it. Instructions could be easier to read and more clear. Seems to have somehow improved my phone signal and data connection too, even when everyone is off work/school.
customer_reviews.author: kbrents

customer_reviews.title: its a fine antenna
customer_reviews.text: i am not well versed in antennas, but this seemed to be fine and worked as expected. I dont know if a cheaper antenna would be much worse, or if a more expensive antenna would be much better- i have nothing to compare to. however, this seemed to work just fine, and picked up way more signals that i expected to get, so if you're in an area where cable is not available, hard to go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Two Shoes

customer_reviews.title: Reception exceeds my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: It was a little challenge to assemble. I’m pretty handy, so I figured it out. Love the idea that I’m not paying for cable TV anymore! It works great and exceeds my expectations. I get all the major TV stations +25 more. I totally recommend this antenna for anyone. I live in a condo on the first floor, which is partially underground. My new antenna is perched on the top of the bookcase near a window. Reception is amazing! (Make sure to do your research and know the location where your TV stations are broadcasted. It took me 30 minutes to find the sweet spot for the best reception.) I am absolutely ecstatic with the results!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Bednarik

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste the extra money
customer_reviews.text: The ClearStream 4V Antenna is VERY disappointing. It did NOT perform as well as the ClearStream 2V. The 4V is bigger and more costly than the 2V. Do not waste the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Works.. on 2nd floor
customer_reviews.text: So I tried this on my main TV and it definitely got nothing, but to be fair that's in the middle of the downstairs in a 2 story house. When I put it on my kids TV upstairs and mounted to the window facing SE where all the channels were I got like 35 channels that came in pretty clear. It's all about where you put it I suppose. Eventually I will get an outdoor antenna and hook up to my other 2 TV's. Works good
customer_reviews.author: Andrea M. Krause

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good indoor antenna!!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a first floor apartment on the far side of the building from the broadcast antennas (about 30 miles). The old antenna owned by the building mounted on the roof was horrible. I tried this new antenna mounted inside above the patio door (not on the glass). After moving back and forth about 6 feet I found the best spot. I now can receive 58 channels. 48 if the 58 come in very clear during good weather. We will see what happens during storms but I expect excellent reception with only a loss of the “marginal” stations. RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: This product proves the adage that bigger is not always better.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very small over-the-air antenna, weighing just a few ounces, and it disappears onto a white wall. I installed it behind my big screen TV, so it is not. visible in my living room. I junked a much larger, much more expensive antenna. I instantly got better coverage on all the available channels I watch (about a dozen, including ABC, CBS, Fox, NBC, PBS, and the CW). The broadcasting antenna farm is about 10 miles from my house, and all the significant over-the-air networks are now received beautifully. No wonder the New York Times "Wirecutter.com" site rated this little antenna "BEST IN SHOW."
customer_reviews.author: Old Austin

customer_reviews.title: Really works-and well!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on our second smart TV. Didn't want the expense of a second cable box (already paying the company more than enough for lousy service), so finally decided to try an antenna. Even just temporarily putting it in the closet gave us multiple stations with pretty good quality. Changed it to a window (using an extra coax cable as the supplied one was too short for my needs) and am now getting 25 stations. Granted many of them, while digital, are broadcasting in Stand Definition, but that's not the fault of the antenna. The stations that are broadcast in HD come in perfectly! A very worthwhile investment.
customer_reviews.author: TMC

customer_reviews.title: So easy, and the HD picture is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I put off installing this for a month because I was scared to try. Now I am back to buy another one in my search to cut the cable! This antenna is amazing. I attached it to my small craft room TV after disconnecting the cable box. The installation couldn’t have been easier - in all, I might have devoted three minutes to the entire process. It was simple to rescan the TV, and the picture is fantastic! I can get my local stations plus a few dozen more. Two more of these, and I will cut cable! Hooray!
customer_reviews.author: kim*designer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: If you cut the cable cord your previous provider will most likely not want the dish itself. This unit has a clamp that will probably work on the old post. No new holes to drill in the roof, assemble it, pop it on the existing post, connect the coax cable that already runs from the roof location to your tv and voila.. I believe my OTA antennae picture is even better than the one I used to get from my satellite dish. I do miss the ability to record right now but for the savings of over $800 I can live with it. Any suggestions for recording OTA programs are welcomed.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Tubbs

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but better than many different bunny ear antennas
customer_reviews.text: Reception with this antenna depends more on where it is placed in a 10x10 foot area than I would have liked but once I found a spot, it worked. I am within about 30 miles or less from my local tv broadcasting towers. When this antenna is not in the right spot, the picture artifacts and stops and starts. But in juuust the right spot, the picture is clear and the signal holds. Being floppy, the antenna isn’t as convenient to place as ridged antennas.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I live 20 miles from the nearest TV antennas and was using an 'in-house' digital antenna for reception. I would very often get pixelation or lost signal. I purchased this along with a pre-amp antenna booster and it works perfectly. Replaced the satellite TV dish on our roof and used the same mast to mount this, amazing. Hope it holds up for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Ketterer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Hung the antenna per instructions and the 2 sided tape lasted 25 minutes before it fell off the wall. My TV in the BR is not near a window so I ran the cable as close as I could get and the reception was ok but I had to stare at a black coax cable on my wall. If I was in a dorm room or a mobile home park no worries but otherwise it looked hideous. Then I just attached it above my TV and got poor reception. I ended up throwing this away and learning my lesson. Going back to powered rabbit ears that always work and look good too!
customer_reviews.author: BorisBulldog

customer_reviews.title: Little flimsy but still works great
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how well this antenna works. I pick up about 41 channels including the local ones and it's really clear. Every once in awhile you have to move it around because the reception sometimes is not as great. But it's easy to move them and the quality of the picture is really fantastic. I wish I had known about this a long time ago I wouldn't have wasted so much money on cable. I recommend this product to anyone looking for a cheap antenna that works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna
customer_reviews.text: When I cut the cable I researched for a long time to buy the proper antenna. I finally settled on this one. I have been very pleased with the result. While I miss some of my channels, I get a lot of new ones. And I certainly don't miss the huge monthly payments for a lot of cable channels that I never used. I would definately recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Pollock

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Getting all OTA channels in my area
customer_reviews.text: I actually helped put this up for a bud last XMas and was very impressed with the picture quality and range. Assembly wasn't a breeze but not complex either. Mounted it outdoors, at a height of around 12 Feet using I used the "antenna pointing" app as a general reference for direction and angle. We are getting all OTA channels from 50 miles away, including local ones. The recepetion is crystal clear with no stuttering The reception is great even during the thunderstorms and heavy rain. Would surely recommend it Would definitely recommend this
customer_reviews.author: ReviewItRight

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the size
customer_reviews.text: It's OK, but I feel for the materials and design, pretty dang pricey. I took a stab at replacing my large Winegard antenna that's inside my attic to see how it would fair. It basically worked as well, but no better, no worse. Bringing the Winegard outside the home, it dialed them all just sitting on the ground. If you don't have a lot of trees, it will work pretty well. I'm about 40 miles out from my local stations and this one just couldn't bring in the NBC stations, especially this time of the year will full foliage on the trees and the atmospheric conditions.
customer_reviews.author: BUDDHA

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: While this antenna pulls in a good deal of channels it seems too sensitive to rain, snow and other atmospheric conditions. 35 miles away from towers with a decent pre amp (properly installed) and all new quality cables, at times the pixelation is excessive. In decent weather it does seem to work quite well. Previously had purchased a forty dollar Chinese special with preamp and rotor built in and it preformed at least as good until the rotor stopped working. Generally disappointed and in hindsight, I would not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Spark

customer_reviews.title: Receives Signals Great!  Somewhat directional, though...
customer_reviews.text: I have cut the cable!! Yahoo!! Item arrived in good condition. I receive some thirty channels with it. I mounted it directly onto my roof deck - about 25 ft. off the ground. I added a few extra screws for secured support. It seems robustly constructed. This is a chunky little devil! I hope it is not a problem in Michigan's brutal winds. I have been using it for about a week now. The unit is not universally "omnidirectional" as reported. Some tweaking and aiming were necessary for best reception. Does not pick up 70 mile range at this height. Seems to be a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Rjp

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great!
customer_reviews.text: After assembling this antenna (with directions that weren't particularly well written), I plugged it in and immediately picked up 4 major, and a bunch of minor, stations.. Pretty impressive since I felt like I'd tried every indoor antenna without success.. I got the channels I was hoping for, and the picture is really clear, most the time. I look forward to mounting it outside, and seeing what I can pick up. I live in Washington, about 35 miles SSE of the broadcast towers in Seattle..
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for us
customer_reviews.text: I do not live in the country at all...15 min from downtown and I'm on top of a hill on the second floor. Not ONE of my local channels comes in. We used a super long cord in order to put the antenna right in the window that faces where the signals come from according to the maps. I get my 43 and fox 68...which are both great stations but I can't even watch Ellen or Grey's when it comes back on. Now I've paid for Hulu live which defeated the whole purpose of getting rid of cable TV bc Spectrum raised my rates AGAIN! 🤬
customer_reviews.author: AJDre

customer_reviews.title: The amplifier made things worse
customer_reviews.text: I've have both the 35+ mile range for awhile and there's a couple channels that keep popping in and out during my channel scans. I decided to try the 50+ mile range one with the included amplifier. However the amplifier only made things worse where even the normal channels I was receiving were no longer available. Removing the amplifier fixed the issue. So to recap: the amplifier only made things worse. There's no actual difference between the antenna itself between the 35+ and 50+ mile range.
customer_reviews.author: Toland H

customer_reviews.title: Great little TV antenna
customer_reviews.text: Installed on an 8 ft pole (from ground level) replacing old sat dish that was installed in the back yard, which is convenient since all the cabling back into the house was already in that location. I'm 55 miles aways from Dallas broadcast tower and getting all the channels with good signal strength. The lowest signal is the lone VHF channel, so the VHF dipole is working, but getting some pixeliation in bad weather on this one channel...might need a little more height (or signal amp). All in all, I'm VERY happy with this antenna and the reception I'm getting!
customer_reviews.author: bg3

customer_reviews.title: Great Piece of Equipment
customer_reviews.text: Using the online locator, I got the compass reading for the San Francisco TV towers, took the antenna up into the attic, and after a few trials, obtained the ideal location by picking a location that shot behind the neighbor's house and gave a direct view to San Francisco. At the moment, it is just leaning against a support until I bolt it down. I have all of the Bay Area stations, including HD broadcasts. Using about 80 feet of coaxial cable. Watched the Super Bowl in HD for free! Customer support is great at Antennas Direct.
customer_reviews.author: RAB

customer_reviews.title: Good OTA antenna
customer_reviews.text: I confess that I watched the Youtube video twice just make sure that I had the assembly down pat. Assembling the antenna took 15-30 minutes, but figuring out where to mount it in my old house took longer. I ended up attaching the antenna to a nail spike on the south side of the house, facing the OTA antennas. We had three bars (out of five bars) with our reception this winter. It'll be interesting to see how much the reception degrades over the summer months when the trees have leaves on them.
customer_reviews.author: rabsparks

customer_reviews.title: Decent Antenna Works for Me
customer_reviews.text: I dumped my satellite service and bought this antenna. It can be used indoors but it is kind of big and ugly so I guess they mean in an attic. I took down my dish and mounted this on the pole and used the same coax to connect to two TV sets. In my location reception is good, flat terrain and short distance to the transmitters. Your results will vary. As for the unit itself the build quality is not great. I expect it to last 3-5 years but it could surprise me, I have only had it up for a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Snarky Quill

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $117 i spent on it.
customer_reviews.text: The antenna man highly recommended this one in a video, but it's not any better than the $20 i bought back in 2018. The Pingbingding antenna with amplifier did just as well for 1/5 of the price. (it actually costs $80 now, not sure why it went up so much). Anyway,,,find one for less than $30. Just because this one looks fancy, don't get fooled.
customer_reviews.author: D. Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: This TV antenna is the best in its class.
customer_reviews.text: This product delivered for my daughter who can't afford cable and has to rely on an over-the-air signal. Before getting this antenna, her TV picture would go in and out and was not very reliable. After we set her up with this antenna, not only was her picture sharper and more reliable, but it allowed her to receive additional TV stations from other nearby cities, a delightful surprise. This antenna has made a world of difference for her. I highly recommend this item for those who need it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good antennae, but not an ideal location where I am. Some channels would flicker.
customer_reviews.text: I think overall it would work better if it faced the direction of most of the TV towers, or if you live in an apartment on an upper floor, but for me (one block from a train track) my 60 mile Mohu did better for me in the LR. I liked the way it's adapter was made and that it sticks to the window. The adapter is better than the MOHU, so I used the square MOHU with that, and gave y daughter this one with the Mohu adapter to try in her 2nd floor apartment to see if it will give her local TV.
customer_reviews.author: DL49120

customer_reviews.title: For me, not as many channels as less-expensive antenna
customer_reviews.text: This was a disappointment for me. I had been using a less-expensive antenna, the kind that's a thin sheet of plastic about the size of a piece of notebook paper. I was getting about 20-30 channels, which was fine, but I was intrigued by the idea of getting more, so I took a chance. This antenna does not receive as many channels as the old one, which cost about half as much. And channels that I lost were channels I watch a lot. After trying this antenna in several spots in the attic, I went back to the old one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chapline

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Antenna!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried about 4 antennas before this one. I LOVE THIS ONE. I have it in my attic of my ranch. I have not had a pixelation or stutter at all. I can watch live tv without issues. It is the best. It is well worth it. It was always irritating watching tv and then having it go in and out. NEVER HAS HAPPENED ONCE with this antenna. I know it is a little more expensive but worth it so you do not have to worry about it. It just works. I would say I am on average about 30 miles away from the nearest tower. Buy this so you dont have to worry about it.
customer_reviews.author: B Ryan Like the Bird

customer_reviews.title: Higher the better, nice reception
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in my attic, nice reception now. Make sure you use the biggest (thickest) type of cable to make sure you get best signal (sorry I can't remember which type that is as I write this). Added a amplifier at the point of distribution to other lines in the house which I assume has helped. Happy with purchase and that the job is finally done!
customer_reviews.author: Gary F. Galletta

customer_reviews.title: Cut the cord!
customer_reviews.text: We live in the mountains of WV, with not too many stations nearby in the first place. This antenna picks up our nearby stations flawlessly. They actually look better than when we had cable. It even pulls in some farther away stations. They’re less reliable, depending on weather, but that’s to be expected. I’m very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Collene

customer_reviews.title: Okay Antenna
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this antenna did not work and pull in as many channels as my other flat antenna. The local channels came in very clear, but I don't care for today's shows on those channels or their news. I prefer MeTV and the Antenna channels, for example, along with some PBS channels, which the latter would not come in at all. I did not realize that you had to attach some sticky tape that is not good to put on glass windows in an apartment that you are renting. That is the only location that would bring in channels. I am trying to return it now.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Starks

customer_reviews.title: Excellant product!
customer_reviews.text: We installed ours on a 20 foot tv tower with an additional 8 foot mast. We live in the woods and routinely pull in stations 75 mile away! We purchased the booster to go with this. The company was very helpful and knowledgeable. Beats satellite and cable bills! This antenna and Netflix is all we need from TV!!!
customer_reviews.author: Green

customer_reviews.title: Finally an antenna that works!
customer_reviews.text: I have a room that does not have a coax connection to the antenna in our attic and needed a stand alone antenna. I tried various models including a magnetic set top rated for 65 miles, a flat amplified one boasting 95 miles and this one. This is the only one that would receive all major stations (fox, nbc, abc, cbs under 20 miles away) without having to adjust or hold at angles for each station. This is in OK, no mountains or major obstructions, but the room is on the opposite side of house from the broadcast antenna direction.
customer_reviews.author: hammersooner

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t perform as well as 50 mile std design antenna.
customer_reviews.text: The seller delivered right away. However I was disappointed in the product and surprised it performed so poorly. I had an inexpensive 50 mile antenna which provided 18-28 stations, I replaced it with this product on same pole, same height, aim, it provided 9 stations! I’ve used one of the 2 circle versions of this in Tucson and it worked great, this one was very poor. 14-38 mile distance, rural Idaho through some trees, mounted in attic. Disappointed and surprised, not what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Legitimately Increases Reception
customer_reviews.text: I had one of those flat HDTV antennas that you can buy at your local costco, but after being frustrated with the limited reception that I received (suburbs of So Cal) I tried my luck with this antenna. The placement hasn't changed, but wow, the reception and quality of the signal has dramatically increased. Not only is the TV able to lock onto more channels, the lock is almost rock solid 100% of the time. There are still a few hiccups that I've come to accept with HDTV, but they're very few and far between.
customer_reviews.author: A. H.

customer_reviews.title: Outperforms the rest I've tried. Getting all channels with solid signal within 25 miles
customer_reviews.text: Tried several mounted to a window, various directions, heights and had issues getting a signal from the towers just 12 miles away- this outperforms them all! Mounted East/West in our dining room 7 feet up between wooden shelving 4 feet from a wall with aluminium siding. Furthest antenna from me I can receive is about 24 miles angled to the NW and I still get a 'good' uninterrupted signal even though it's not aligned. VERY HAPPY with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Antenna!
customer_reviews.text: Great Antenna! I was sick of paying a ridiculous amount for cable so I cut the cord and got two of these. I have about 25 channels and I don't even have the antennas in a good spot - one TV is in a window barren room so it's not any where close to a window and I still get good reception and CBS and NBC and FOX and some movie channels and COZI TV etc. And it looks nice and is small enough not to be clunky and in the way. SO worth the one time price!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Alton

customer_reviews.title: Works as Well as More Expensive Antenna
customer_reviews.text: As a recent cord-cutter, I have three TV's I needed to hook up. Although this does not come with any of the bells and whistles found with my more expensive Mohu Leaf, I receive the same channels with the same clarity. I bought one Mohu (which states it pulls in stations from 60 miles away) and later two ClearStream (which state a 35-mile radius). If I don't have more stations beyond that 35 miles, paying more is of little use it seems. This is barebones in terms of what is in the box, but it provided all I needed.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieInAcworth

customer_reviews.title: Reliable to an extent. Not too well in Basement
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to be used in our basement since we don't want the antenna cable to be stretch across the room, going antenna-less was our only option. When it comes down to using it in the basement, we some times see the streaming "skip" / "cut in and out" of focus. I was looking for something that can withstand it. I still give it 3 stars for functionality. If we did a auto channel run again the streaming gets back in focus and you won't have to do it again unless a storm kicks in.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth T.

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but great improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to put together but was successful. Installing on roof was a bit testy for a senior woman but I am as successful. Did scan, first scan was good enough for me and tightened up clamps. Used it costing j-pole from satellite dish. Only concern is it's longevity but hope it lives up to it's cost which I thought was pricey. Reception had greatly improved and pixeling, so far, none. Was recommended by "The Antenna Man". Also, gained 6 channels I never had before because of the trees.
customer_reviews.author: Granny White

product_meta.title: Antennas Direct Clearstream 4V TV Antenna, 70+ Mile Range, UHF/Vhf, Multi-Directional, Indoor, Attic, Outdoor, Mast W/Pivoting Base/Hardware/Adjustable Clamp/Sealing Pads, 4K Ready, Black – C4-V-CJM
product_meta.description: Style:70 MilesThe clear stream 4V HDTV antenna uses patented technology to receive free TV signals up to 70 miles away from networks like ABC, CBS, NBC, Fox, PBS, Univision, and more in full HD 1080 where available. [Note: network reception will vary by market, signal availability, and broadcast tower locations]. mount indoors, in the attic, or outdoors for the best results. As a leader in cutting-edge antenna technology, Antennas Direct is dedicated to providing superior products supported by a lifetime and a world class call center located in St. Louis, mo. Includes clear stream 4V antenna, 20in mount, all-weather mounting hardware, and instructions. Coaxial cable sold separately.
feature_bullets: Best performance among all antennas rated in the 70 mile range category [NOTE: Location, obstructions, and building materials effect reception]
Receive free TV from networks like ABC, CBS, NBC, Fox, CW, PBS, Univision, Me TV and more in 1080 where available
Dedicated UHF and VHF multi-directional elements deliver range and reception in less than ideal locations. Gain: UHF 11 dBi / VHF 2.5 dBi
Includes Clear Stream 4V Antenna, 20in mount, all-weather mounting hardware, and instructions (coaxial cable sold separately)
Lifetime Warranty on parts. Please Note: Kindly refer the User Manual before use which is very essential for this product.Antenna Gain (dB):3.1

specifications.Special Features: Long Range, Multidirectional, High Gain, Dual Band
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars5,017 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
